title: Volunteers Crossing the Ohio from Cincinnati to Covington
alternateTitle: Civil War prints : includes Cincinnati and non-Cincinnati items. 13

source.publication: Harper's History of the Great Rebellion

location.subject: Ohio River crossing between Cincinnati and Covington during Civil War

viewpoint.description: Panoramic view showing volunteers crossing on coal boat bridge with Suspension Bridge construction

historicalContext.significance: Shows beginning stages of Suspension Bridge construction and wartime river crossing

description: Historic June 1862 engraving by Henry Mosler depicting Union volunteers crossing the Ohio River from Cincinnati to Covington on a bridge of connected coal boats. This Civil War era illustration shows the panoramic view of Cincinnati during wartime, including the beginning stages of the Suspension Bridge construction, capturing a significant moment in the city's Civil War history.
